messages.message: Oh yea this is a common python gotcha because of when default arguments are instantiated (it’s not when the function is called). This guide (https://docs.python-guide.org/writing/gotchas/) explains it and might have some other useful content.
I feel like we should lint for this to help people not lose a ton of time debugging this issue? it’s very non-intuitive and I often write code with default args that are mutable
